This is the first time that anyone has described your vague interest in the Strong painting as a “topic.” The word sounds good—weighty, as if you were an established scholar.

But in its still jetlagged state, your brain is whirring with questions: who will pay? Can you face yet more international travel? What about the Block Seminar? Do you need a visa? Could Lorraine help you?

“The point is this,” Prof Moira continues. “Obviously proper radio reporting necessitates a trip to Hawai‘i, I’m sure you’ll agree. For this we can spend the outreach budget—and you can do some preliminary work for your own PhD, too. I have dear friends in Honolulu who can help you, and this Laurel woman you met at the conference is another contact. And you can still be back for the Block Seminar in ten days. What do you think?”
